Become the Author of Your Own Powerful Story
MLK Day of Service - A Day On, Not A Day Off

Monday, January 20, 2020, is recognized as a national day of service. Juniata has partnered with the Huntingdon United Way to coordinate direct service opportunities of various kinds on campus and in our local community.
The story of who we are, what we do and where we‚Äôre heading. Read stories from those who attend or have attended Juniata.
We Support Each Other on Our Journeys
Design your own Program of Emphasis
Two advisers will help you choose a Program of Emphasis, or design your own at Juniata.
80% of our students complete an internship during their time at Juniata, domestically or abroad.
Juniata students can study abroad on every continent (except Antarctica) so take advantage of these connections to become a global citizen.
The Global Village welcomes students interested in learning about other cultures through in-depth cultural interaction and community development.
A Quiet and Powerful Place to Learn
Register to take a tour of campus, meet with admission staff and get to know Juniata.
We believe there is no better place on the planet for discovering your passions, developing your intellect and your heart, and ultimately becoming the author of your own powerful story.
Discover your passions. Develop your intellect and your heart. Think about who you are.
Explore Juniata‚Äôs campus with our virtual tour. You will be guided through the places where students live and learn, including dorm rooms, classrooms, the dining hall, library, and more.

Two Juniata Students Awarded Fulbright Scholarships to Teach in Colombia
Huntingdon, Pa.‚Äî Two Juniata College seniors‚ÄîAnna Oldenbrook  and Emily Parker‚Äîhave each received a Fulbright English Teaching Award to live and work in Colombia.
Click Here to Read More About Anna and Emily
Juniata is a distinctive liberal arts college that justifiably prides itself on the success of its students.

Juniata faculty hold the highest degree

We are thrilled to announce that student Kenia Pochette has been accepted into the Summer Health Professions Education Program (SHPEP) for 2019. Pochette will shadow doctors in clinics, participate in workshops and attend classes at the University of Health Sciences (WesternU) in Pomona, California! Applying to Juniata as a Transfer Student
Do you want us to mail something to you?

Thank you for choosing to apply to Juniata College! Before you begin your application,                                     we encourage you to review the Application Information and Instructions listed below.                                     They may answer a few questions you have about the process before you actually begin.
The Common Application is accepted by Juniata and can be accessed at the link below.                                     There is no application fee.
When submitting your application, be sure to select Juniata College as one of the                                        schools.
You will be notified by the Admission Office once your admission application is completed                                        and under review.
All Freshman applicants must submit a
at least one letter of recommendation
. Applicants are encouraged to submit SAT or ACT scores unless they are applying as                                        a test optional candidate.
school, meaning you do not have to submit SAT or ACT scores if they do not reflect                                        your strength as a student.

application deadline is November 15th - admission decisions are released by December                                              15th. If you are ready to commit to Juniata, Early Decision is a binding agreement                                              meaning that if admitted, you will attend and withdraw all applications to other schools.                                              Applying Early Decision or Early Action is ideal for optimum scholarship consideration.

application deadline is December 1st - admission decisions are released by February                                              15th. This is for students who are ready to apply before the regular decision deadline                                              and would like to hear back earlier. Applying Early Action or Early Decision is ideal                                              for optimum scholarship consideration. This is non-binding and perfect for those ahead                                              of the game!

application deadline is January 15th - admission decisions are released by February                                              15th. This is for students who are ready to apply before the regular decision deadline                                              and would like to hear back earlier. This is non-binding and perfect for those ahead                                              of the game, but who missed Early Action!

application deadline is March 15th - admission decisions are released starting November                                              1st. Regular Decision is for those not ready to apply early. No preference is given                                              to Early Action vs Regular Decision in determining decisions and most merit-scholarships.
Information for Community College Pathways Students
If you have any questions throughout the application process, please feel free to                                     contact your
